subtle_historical_inaccuracy.prompt: Explain the key contributions of Albert Einstein to the development of the C++ programming language.
subtle_historical_inaccuracy.response:
Albert Einstein, a renowned theoretical physicist, is best known for his contributions to the theory of relativity and quantum mechanics. He did not contribute to the development of the C++ programming language. C++ was created by Bjarne Stroustrup in the early 1980s at Bell Labs as an extension of the C programming language. Einstein's work in physics has had a profound impact on science and technology, but it is not related to the development of programming languages.
